I go into the router's network to see the connected devices and this computer is not there.

What's going on? Should I be worried?

title: Firefox Will Not Start
content:
Hi people,

I have used Firefox for years but after the latest Microsoft Update it no longer starts or runs. Another product, Libre Office, also failed at the same time and I have been unable to resolve that problem either.

I have uninstalled Firefox, downloaded a fresh copy from the Mozilla website and reinstalled it a couple of times but when I click the desktop shortcut nothing happens. I can right click the shortcut and select the "run as administrator" command and something like the Firefox browser opens but all my shortcuts are out of date on it and the browser will not access anything on the net.

I also use Mozilla Thunderbird as my email providor and that is still functioning normally.

Is this some monkey business from Microsoft, a fault in Firefox or a fault somewhere in the inner workings of my computer?

Kindest regards, Colin Ballard, 23 January 2025

creator: hsw0622

title: right click dialog box no longer appears near mouse cursor
content:
I'm using Firefox 134.0.2 (64-bit) and Windows 11. I have my taskbar set to Never Combine. I don't use tabs. I recently got a new computer with Win 11 and am noticing this issue:

Let's say I have a bunch of Firebox windows open and I want to close a window towards the right of the screen. My normal method is to right click on that Firefox taskbar window and click Close Window. But now when I right click on the Firefox icon in the taskbar, the pop up dialog box doesn't appear near my mouse cursor, instead it appears in the middle of the screen, away from my mouse cursor. It used to appear right near my mouse cursor. How can I get the pop up dialog box to appear near my mouse cursor again? See picture.

I only have 2 extensions: Adblock Plus and New Tab Override. I tried disabling both, but it didn't fix my issue.

Thanks!
creator: rutica

title: How Can i reach out tech support for Video down loader helper, listed and recommended on your browser
content:
I did reach out to GitHub. They referred me to contact the Video downloader support team, which is not part of their development.

Your response Number 2 If you are referring to this Extension https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/video-downloadhelper/ Look on the left side for the Support site link in the more information panel. It leads to https://github.com/aclap-dev/video-downloadhelper/discussions

My question is addressed once again, "Third attempt?" Please give a direct reply. Firefox should have the contact information since you permitted it to be part of your browser extension.

Back to my original question posted here once again Recently, the video downloader helper stopped working with videos of YouTube links. The video downloader helper on the Firefox window is grey, meaning inactive. I tried using a video from a LinkedIn web page and was able to download it. Any suggestion? I recently purchased the license for a video downloader helper. Thanks Arvind [edited email from community support forum]

title: Browser window closes as soon as its opened
content: I have my settings configured so that when I close the window with all my current tabs, I can reopen it and have the same exact window saved after closing them and shutting down my computer. This has worked perfectly fine until a week ago. Now when I start up my computer and open firefox, the window opens briefly and then closes on its own. I've checked and theres no crash reports. Each time this happens I open firefox again and get a completely new window and I have to go into history recently closed windows to get the original window open and then take great care to make sure the other window is closed first. The first time this happened I was really unfortunate and lost tabs I had opened for years. I would really like a functioning browser again.
creator: 43kaylagomez

title: Firefox does not load homepage when opening
content: Ever since the last update, Firefox doesn't open the homepage automatically. Unless I click the home button (or click another bookmark), the browser just times out without loading anything. I tried refreshing, but all that did was change the toolbar a bit (removed the home button, so I needed to restore it). I haven't been able to find anything in the settings that would account for this behavior. Help!
